metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12363 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
Improper input validation in some Intel(R) Graphics Drivers for Windows*before version 26.20.100.7212 and before Linux kernel version 5.5 may allowa privileged user to potentially enable a denial of service via localaccess.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.11.0-22-generic - 5.11.0-22.23~20.04.1
linux-image-5.11.0-22-generic-lpae - 5.11.0-22.23~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.11.0-22-generic - 5.11.0-22.23~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.11.0-22-generic-64k - 5.11.0-22.23~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.11.0-22-lowlatency - 5.11.0-22.23~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1009-oem - 5.13.0-1009.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.11.0-1009-aws - 5.11.0-1009.9~20.04.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-generic-64k - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-lowlatency - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1008-aws - 5.13.0-1008.9~20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11, was needed').
linux-kvm package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
